intro: Achyronia microdon, commonly known as the small green orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and swampy areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a short, underground rhizome. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Achyronia microdon is considered a threatened species.
